description: A forest fire danger index (FDI) or burning index (BI) is a relative number related to the contribution that fire behavior makes to the amount of effort needed to contain a fire of a specified fuel type. The index may be calculated differently by different agencies around the world.[See the American Meteorological Society Glossary of Meteorology Online: http://amsglossary.allenpress.com/glossary. For other fire weather terms, see: http://www.fs.fed.us/r2/fire/fbgloss.htm
title: Forest Fire Danger Index
